优化是决策科学及物理系统分析中一个极其重要的工具。为了能够使用这个工具，首先需要确定某个目标，即度量研究问题本质的量，这个量可能是利益，时间，内能等等。目标依赖于研究对象的属性，即所谓的变量或未知数。通常自变量会受一定的约束，如分子中的电子密度和贷款利率不可能是负的。确定目标，未知量及约束条件即完成了建模的过程。然后寻找优化算法计算自变量以达到最优的目标。没有通用的优化算法，有的是优化算法集，每个算法只针对特定类型的优化问题。因此，选择尤为重要，这不仅决定了求解问题的快慢，甚至决定了能否求解。本门课程旨在讲授数值优化的基本理论和基本的优化算法，要求通过本课程的学习，具有应用数值优化方法解决一些实际问题的初步技能。

作为一个重要的建模策略，线性统计模型是关于调查所谓的一个或多个解释变量（如年龄，性别，血压等）是否以及如何影响响??应变量，如患者的诊断，考虑数据的随机变化。在线性统计模型中，假设线性回归和正态分布是为了探索连续反应和一个或多个解释变量之间可能的线性关系。进一步，去掉线性和正态性这两个线性统计模型中非常严格的限制，我们讨论指数族分布这个经常遇到的分布族，相应将模型推广为广义线性模型（GLM）。 GLM一方面统一了统计建模策略中的线性和非线性模型。另一方面，它可以用来分析离散数据，包括在生物医学，经济和社会科学以及工业应用中经常出现的二元、二项分布、计数和分类数据。

数据挖掘的数据预处理解决了众所周知的数据处理知识发现过程中最重要的问题之一，直接从数据源获取的数据可能存在不一致性，错误或者最重要的是，尚未准备好对数据进行考虑另外，近年来科学，工业和商业应用中的数据量越来越大，这就需要更复杂的工具来分析数据，通过数据预处理，可以将不可能转化为可能，使数据适应满足各种数据挖掘算法的输入需求，数据预处理包括数据压缩技术，旨在降低数据的复杂度，从数据中检测或去除不相关的和有噪声的元素。
本书旨在回顾弥补从数据源获取和数据挖掘过程之间的差距的任务。从实践的角度，包括基本概念和对专业文献中提出的技术的调查，给出了一个全面的看法。每一章都是一个独立的指导一个特定的数据预处理主题，从经典算法的基本概念和详细的描述入侵近期事态发展的详尽目录。深入的技术描述使本书适合数据科学，计算机科学和工程领域的技术专业人员，研究人员，高级本科生和研究生。

Statistical Analysis with Noisy Data and Introduction to Survival Analysis
Statistical Analysis with Noisy Data and Introduction to Survival Analysis

Thanks to the advancement of modern technology in acquiring data, data with diversefeatures and big volume are becoming more accessible than ever. While the abundant volumeof data presents great opportunities for researchers to extract useful information for newknowledge gain and sensible decision making, big data present great challenges. A veryimportant, sometimes overlooked challenge is the quality and provenance of the data. Bigdata are not automatically useful; big data are often raw and involve considerable noise.Typically, the challenges presented by measurement error and missing observations areparticularly intriguing. Measurement error and missing data arise ubiquitously from various fields including health sciences, epidemiological studies, survey research, environmentalstudies, economics, and so on. They have been a long standing concern in data analysis andhave attracted extensive research interest over the past few decades.It has been well documented that ignoring measurement error or missing data in statis-tical analyses may lead to erroneous or even misleading results. The effects of measurementerror or missing data are, however, complex, and are affected by various factors. The objective of this course is to lead the audience to visit these challenging but exciting areas.Specifically, the impact of measurement error and missing data will be demonstrated anddifferent types of measurement error models and missing data mechanisms will be discussed.Typical inference strategies for handling measurement error and missing data will be described. The discussion will be illustrated with examples and applications.

Creative and logical thinking have been emphasized as skills that are especially important in the 21st century (Hearsh, 1997). As a discipline that involves both, mathematics is an ideal subject to develop such thinking (Burger & Starbird, 2012; Frenkel, 2013). However, many people tend to believe that mathematics is too difficult for them so they are simply not good at mathematics. In this course, students will investigate the beauty of mathematics through hands-on activities (e.g., creating tessellations, golden ratio art, fractal cards, etc.), group discussion, and lectures on the mathematical principles behind such activities. Through this course, students will experience how mathematics has impact on art from different cultures and is an integral part of aesthetic appreciation.
